snippet: California N.A.A.C.P. officials are reviewing why the group planned an award for Donald Sterling, who has been accused of racially offensive comments.
abstract: Officials from California state conference of NAACP are reviewing why small Los Angeles branch was planning to give lifetime achievement award, one of group's highest honors, to Donald Sterling, Los Angeles Clippers owner who has been accused of racially offensive comments that led NBA to ban him for life from league activity.

byline.contributor: Ian Lovett and Adam Nagourney contributed reporting from Los Angeles. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: California N.A.A.C.P. officials are reviewing why the group planned an award for Donald Sterling, who has been accused of racially offensive comments.

headline.main: N.A.A.C.P. Scrutinizes Branch Over Honor for Clippers Owner
headline.print_headline: N.A.A.C.P. Scrutinizes Branch Over Honor for Clippers Owner

keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
keywords.name: organizations
